comment.shortText: Convenience functions for child process access, wrapped in Promises.
comment.text:
### Usage:
```
import { node } from 'hsnode';
node.child_process.exec('ls')
    .then((stdout, stderr) => {...})
    .catch(err => {...});
```

comment.shortText:
executes `command` in a child process and promises to return the stdout and stderr streams. 
let utils = require('./cpUtils');
utils.exec(cmd)
.then((stdout, stderr) => {...})
.catch(err => {...});
comment.returns: promise to provide the stdout and stderr streams from the child process.

comment.returns: promise to provide the stdout and stderr streams from the child process.

comment.shortText: the shell command to execute
the options to pass along to the shell
Convenience functions for node file system functions, wrapped in Promises.
appends to a file either as binary or text and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the realPath of the file written to.

comment.text: `true`|`false` if file should be read as `utf8`|binary

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` is a directory and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` is a file and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` is a directory and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText:
returns a promise for the stats of the file addressed by `thePath`.
If `thePath` addresses a symbolic link, the stats of the link are returned.

creates any missing directories in `thePath` and promises to return the path name.
Characters after the last `/` in `thePath` will be interpreted as a filename, hence no directory willbe created form them.
Terminate `thePath` with a final `/` to indicate that all parts should be created.
FInally, for precaution `mkdirs` only creates directories within the current working directory.
comment.returns: promise to provide the path name

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` exists and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText: lists all files in a directory and promises to provide the list.
comment.returns: promise to provide a list of directory entries.

comment.shortText: reads a file either as binary or text and promises to provide the content.
comment.returns: promise to provide file content.

comment.text: `true`|`false` if file should be read as `utf8`|binary

comment.shortText: reads a text file and promises to provide the content.
comment.returns: promise to provide file content.

comment.shortText: reads a text file and promises to provide the content.
comment.returns: promise to provide file content.

comment.shortText: determines the canonical path for `thePath`, resolving all symbolic links and '../'in the path.
comment.returns: promise to provide the real canonical system path.

comment.shortText: promises to delete a file or folder and return the file or folder name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the name of the removed file.

comment.shortText:
returns a promise for the stats of the file addressed by `thePath`.
If `thePath` addresses a symbolic link, the stats of the linked file are returned.
writes a file either as binary or text and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.text: `true`|`false` if file should be read as `utf8`|binary

comment.shortText: writes a text file and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.shortText: writes content to a file as a stream and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.shortText: writes a text file and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.shortText:
# Utility functions for HTTP and HTTPS calls
Convenience functions for http and https access, wrapped in Promises.
-   {@link httpUtil.request request}: sends a http or https GET or POST request
-   {@link httpUtil.CachedHTTPGet CachedHTTPGet}: used for cached requests
Implements a Digest authentication, used in {@link request `request`} call.
Parse challenge digest
Update and zero pad nc

constructs the cache name to use. The function call can be overwritten with
a custom function to modify cache locations.

constructs the cache name to use. The function call can be overwritten with
a custom function to modify cache locations.
the request options

issues a `GET` or `POST` call and returns the `url` response.
If `usedCache` is `true`, the cached version will be returned if available.
Otherwise an `http` or `https` request is initiated, the result cached and returned.
If `decodeJSON` returns `true` for the given url, an attempt will be made to covert
the retrieved content to a JSON object.

comment.text:
if `true`, attempt to return a cahced version. If `false`, or no cached version
exists, a remote call will be attempted.
data to submit for a `POST` call

comment.shortText: sets a `Pace` for the requests:
sets a `Pace` for the requests:
number of ms between requests
upper limit of concurrent outstanding requests
Describes an incoming message; used in `Digest.testDigestAuth`
general HTTP response structure
Compose authorization header
return `true` if double quotes are needed for `entry`
Decodes an xm or html string into a JSON representation

comment.shortText: the shell command to execute
the options to pass along to the shell
## log module
name of the current log file, or undefined
temporary color setting, defined in call to `inspect()` and used in `getPrePostfix`

configures the log facility.
- cfg.colors: boolean, determines if output is colored
- cfg.logfile: sets the naming template for the logfile. Set logFile=null to disable.
- cfg.format: sets the format for the timestamp for each log entry
- cfg.level: sets the reporting level (same as calling log.level())
returns a string representation of an object literal, similar to the Node `util.inspect` call.
comment.text:
Usage: `log.info(log.inspect(struct, 1))`

The call returns a raw formatted text string, or a HTM formatted string if `colors` is defined.
depth of recursion, defaults to 1. Use `null` for infinite depth
the indent string to use, will accumulate for each level of indentation, defaults to ''

an array of css color values to apply to keywords in the inspected structure;
if present, `inspect` will generate HTML content instead of raw text, substituting any `space` characters
(' ') with ` `. The color applied to each keyword cycles through the array with each increasing level,
and restarts at index 0 when the level exceeds the length of the array.

comment.shortText:
sets a new logfile name template. Logfiles are created using this template
at the time of each log entry call. If the file exists, the log entry will be appended.
This is a global setting that affects reporting in all modules.
Usage:
- `logFile()`: return the current logfile name
- `logFile(null)`: disable log file
- `logFile('')`: set default log file template `log-%YYYY-%MM-%DD.txt`
- `logFile('log%D/%M/%Y.log')`: set new log file template
comment.returns: promise to return the current logfile name, or `undefined` if loggimng is disabled.

comment.text: a template to use for log file names. Options for calling:

comment.shortText:
Creates the core format of the reported message. This method is
called within `out` to allow for
- format extensions using color codes.
- logging messages to a file.

reports a transient message to the log. This is an `INFO` level message that omits the
`line feed` character (i.e. `carriage return` only) so that it will be overwritten
by the next logging output. Internally
comment.returns: promise to return the file written to, or undefined

comment.text: the message to report. If msg is an object literal, a deep inspection will be printed.

comment.shortText: boolean determining if log will be printed in color
shell color escape codes
